publicwhip.spmotion: *S1M-1394 Dorothy-Grace Elder: Polish Links with Scotland-That the Parliament congratulates Stirling University on its superb initiative in establishing the Centre for Research in Polish History and expresses great pleasure that Dr Stanislaw Kornorowski, the Polish Ambassador, is delivering the inaugural annual lecture on 29 November 2000 which is being dedicated to the memory of the heroic General Stanislaw Maczek; pays tribute to the vibrant contribution to life in Scotland made by the Polish community, and hopes that, through the new centre, people will honour the massive wartime effort of Poles in the liberation of Europe, from the Polish mathematicians who were amongst those who cracked the Enigma code to the Polish forces who trained in Scotland for some of the most ferocious battles of the Second World War.

S1M-1394 Dorothy-Grace Elder: Polish Links with Scotland-That the Parliament congratulates Stirling University on its superb initiative in establishing the Centre for Research in Polish History and expresses great pleasure that Dr Stanislaw Kornorowski, the Polish Ambassador, is delivering the inaugural annual lecture on 29 November 2000 which is being dedicated to the memory of the heroic General Stanislaw Maczek; pays tribute to the vibrant contribution to life in Scotland made by the Polish community, and hopes that, through the new centre, people will honour the massive wartime effort of Poles in the liberation of Europe, from the Polish mathematicians who were amongst those who cracked the Enigma code to the Polish forces who trained in Scotland for some of the most ferocious battles of the Second World War. Supported by: Fiona McLeod*
S1M-1394 Polish Links with Scotland (lodged on 27 November 2000) Donald Gorrie*
S1M-1394 Polish Links with Scotland (lodged on 27 November 2000) Nora Radcliffe*, Ms Sandra White*
S1M-1394 Polish Links with Scotland (lodged on 27 November 2000) Alex Neil*, Mr Adam Ingram*
S1M-1394 Polish Links with Scotland (lodged on 27 November 2000) Tommy Sheridan*

S1M-1394 Dorothy-Grace Elder: Polish Links with Scotland-That the Parliament congratulates Stirling University on its superb initiative in establishing the Centre for Research in Polish History and expresses great pleasure that Dr Stanislaw Kornorowski, the Polish Ambassador, is delivering the inaugural annual lecture on 29 November 2000 which is being dedicated to the memory of the heroic General Stanislaw Maczek; pays tribute to the vibrant contribution to life in Scotland made by the Polish community, and hopes that, through the new centre, people will honour the massive wartime effort of Poles in the liberation of Europe, from the Polish mathematicians who were amongst those who cracked the Enigma code to the Polish forces who trained in Scotland for some of the most ferocious battles of the Second World War. Supported by: Fiona McLeod, Donald Gorrie, Nora Radcliffe, Ms Sandra White, Alex Neil, Mr Adam Ingram, Tommy Sheridan
S1M-1394 Polish Links with Scotland (lodged on 27 November 2000) Andrew Wilson*

S1M-1394 Dorothy-Grace Elder: Polish Links with Scotland-That the Parliament congratulates Stirling University on its superb initiative in establishing the Centre for Research in Polish History and expresses great pleasure that Dr Stanislaw Kornorowski, the Polish Ambassador, is delivering the inaugural annual lecture on 29 November 2000 which is being dedicated to the memory of the heroic General Stanislaw Maczek; pays tribute to the vibrant contribution to life in Scotland made by the Polish community, and hopes that, through the new centre, people will honour the massive wartime effort of Poles in the liberation of Europe, from the Polish mathematicians who were amongst those who cracked the Enigma code to the Polish forces who trained in Scotland for some of the most ferocious battles of the Second World War. S1M-1394 Polish Links with Scotland (lodged on 27 November 2000) Robert Brown*
S1M-1394 Polish Links with Scotland (lodged on 27 November 2000) Mr Lloyd Quinan*

S1M-1394 Dorothy-Grace Elder: Polish Links with Scotland—That the Parliament congratulates Stirling University on its superb initiative in establishing the Centre for Research in Polish History and expresses great pleasure that Dr Stanislaw Kornorowski, the Polish Ambassador, is delivering the inaugural annual lecture on 29 November 2000 which is being dedicated to the memory of the heroic General Stanislaw Maczek; pays tribute to the vibrant contribution to life in Scotland made by the Polish community, and hopes that, through the new centre, people will honour the massive wartime effort of Poles in the liberation of Europe, from the Polish mathematicians who were amongst those who cracked the Enigma code to the Polish forces who trained in Scotland for some of the most ferocious battles of the Second World War. Supported by: Fiona McLeod, Donald Gorrie, Nora Radcliffe, Ms Sandra White, Alex Neil, Mr Adam Ingram, Tommy Sheridan, Andrew Wilson, Robert Brown, Mr Lloyd Quinan
S1M-1394 Polish Links with Scotland (lodged on 27 November 2000) Roseanna Cunningham*
S1M-1394 Polish Links with Scotland (lodged on 27 November 2000) Dr Richard Simpson*

S1M-1394 Dorothy-Grace Elder: Polish Links with Scotland—That the Parliament congratulates Stirling University on its superb initiative in establishing the Centre for Research in Polish History and expresses great pleasure that Dr Stanislaw Kornorowski, the Polish Ambassador, is delivering the inaugural annual lecture on 29 November 2000 which is being dedicated to the memory of the heroic General Stanislaw Maczek; pays tribute to the vibrant contribution to life in Scotland made by the Polish community, and hopes that, through the new centre, people will honour the massive wartime effort of Poles in the liberation of Europe, from the Polish mathematicians who were amongst those who cracked the Enigma code to the Polish forces who trained in Scotland for some of the most ferocious battles of the Second World War. Supported by: Fiona McLeod, Donald Gorrie, Nora Radcliffe, Ms Sandra White, Alex Neil, Mr Adam Ingram, Tommy Sheridan, Andrew Wilson, Robert Brown, Mr Lloyd Quinan, Roseanna Cunningham, Dr Richard Simpson
